intro: Lophospermum breedlovei, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame vine, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange tubular flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. It is a climbing vine that can reach lengths of several meters, using its tendrils to attach to supports. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
